title: Players should have the option to ping "Need Vision"
body:
So my thought is... we have the "Enemy Has Vision here" ping, however when you're in solo queue and you find yourself in a situation where you no longer have wards to place you should have a "Need Vision" ping so you could point out objectives that need warding or good ward spots to your teammates.
it would solve Riot's problem of lower ranks not warding enough if you could help your fellow players remember by pinging.
if you do manage to get around to putting it in (because i know riot has alot on their plates atm with the new patches) you could make it the same as the "Enemy has vision here" ping but then just make it blue and have a different sound.

Thanks for reading 
{{champion:2}}

replies.body:
I'm actually really interested/invested in us creating more pings for players to use. When we made the "enemy vision here ping", we talked a bit about whether we could/should make more, but given the tech limitations (couldn't swap out pings on the ping wheel), I opted instead to just do the highest use case one (that the bush has a ward in it to warn your teammates). With the emotes wheel tech being complete, I'm **_hopeful_** that we'll actually be able to do stuff like this in the near future with some sort of configurable ping wheel (or maybe even a second one?). Your specific idea also came up in the dev corner post I made last december looking for dope ideas for 2018 (https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/aG96Psz9-featureqol-changeidea-generator-for-2018-and-beyond?sort_type=best&comment=0030), so it's obvious that the demand is there.

I'd love for us to be able to expand this beyond adding the "need vision here" ping, so here's an open question for all you folks reading this. Assume that you were in a game and had neither voice comms, or the ability to type. What are the most useful ping additions you think would be valuable for helping you coordinate with a team?

Ping Pitch:
The "shit nvm" ping

Use case: I just pinged that my enemy laner was mia, but then they came back into the lane out of fog of war. I'd love to be able to ping "nvm" or *erase* the initial ping to let my team know that there's no imminent threat.

I'd rather if pinging them on the scoreboard wrote **In Fog of War** or **Missing** instead of _Alive_.
Also it would have a built-in timestamp in case allies don't have them enabled.

Might be a personal preference though.

Interesting idea - I think the alive callout has very specific use cases (when youre pushing base and tracking death timers), but a "in fow" or "missing" seems really slick. That being said, other people may like it saying "alive", would need to do more digging first but I like the suggestion as a simple tweak.
Maybe "Alive, Missing" "Alive, Visible" and 'Very much not Alive"
"he ded"
#JustKarthusThings
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/tYjig6EoCMI/maxresdefault.jpg

"Very much not Alive"

I'm finding this way funnier than I should be. XD
I laughed for a good minute or two haha

Letting us ping the ? would be a good middle ground.  Then we could have both.

Edit: also (backtracking to the OP's suggestion of a need vision ping) We need a wording kinda like "Ward please."
That way people can use it to get their allies to drop a ---------- ward down when they want to tp in.

If explored, you guys will see internally which wording works best though ofc.
if this comes true then we can actually have separate pings for MIA pings and WTF pings; hope it happpens
How about making a custom ping tab like with emotes ? Just put anything reasonable in there and people will use what they want.

That's actually what I was referring to in my initial reply, the custom wheel with emotes would be the ideal solve here, since the tech has been built, but more importantly, players understand how to use it.

SMITE is a moba that uses a hotkey system combined with the announcer to alert their team to mia's, or to shotcall objectives and plays. Not saying that the announcer would be a great addition as it could be easily spammed and abused, but it'd be interesting to apply your new tech in a way where you could make lane-specific calls.

For instance if left on the wheel created another top-lane specific wheel where you can ping mia, returned, attack tower, etc. Up on the initial wheel would toggle mid lane specific pings, and so on.

It would create a wheel within a wheel, but would allow for more concise/specific information for you to pass on to your team. I feel that the with the current ping system, it's easy for people to ignore the details of a ping because they're ambiguous. A lot of players are too used to hearing it, or see "missing" but don't take into account what lane the ping is from.

Oh spicy. Given some sort of throttling, having a sort of announcer callout of "Annie is missing" that isn't overwhelming or spammable seems really cool. Lots of abuse cases we'd need to iron out, but definitely an interesting alternative to pings.

One of the things we've talked about (but not sure we'll do yet), is adding 3d directional audio for pings. If you've played pubg you can tell when a gun was fired, what direction, and how far away (ish). If you're playing mid lane and bot pings mia, imagine that you'd be able to here the ping with stereo sound, and tell that it came from bot. 

I'm a bit dubious of super specific use cases like attack the tower, since we already get that by pinging on turrets, but there's likely some additional strategic pings that could be made.

There is currently 3 separate ping keys(regular, warning, enemy vision), of which two result in the same exact ping wheel when held.
We could easily have it cut down to two keys, let's call them "Inform" and "Alert", with each having it's own wheel of options.

Hell, just having a note "(location unknown)" when pinging an enemy we cannot see on the scoreboard would be a major improvement.

Yeah the announcer is definitely spicy, especially if you throttled its usage so that it wasn't spammable. With all that is going on in a game, and the amount of micro each player has with respect to their role, I just think sometimes players fail to acknowledge where pings are coming from, their importance, or just fail to differentiate the sounds.

Often times someone will rapidly ping something like "mia", so you hear a bunch of quick pings and experienced or more mindful players will look at the map or chat quickly to see what the sound is related to, for many others these pings are lost.

Coupled with many people listening to music or doing whatever else they may be doing while playing, announcer saying "enemy mid is missing" is harder to ignore.

Can we get a "Get the fuck outta my lane ping" for when spamming danger 6 times on the jungler isn't enough? Like, bro, I'm under my tower with a wave and a half of minions, this is NOT the time to gank the full HP illaoi who has R while you're on half HP.

Obviously the ping symbol would be a giant "REPORTED" in red text (maybe flashing too, or cycling through various shades of yellow to orange to red) and the sound would be nails on a chalkboard so they can't ignore it. Make it a special case where it's unmuteable too. Maybe it could also spawn some fake honeyfruit overlays in the river? Junglers seem to like those about as much as taxing my lane, maybe it would dissuade them somewhat

Pls Rito this would make me almost as happy as the Aatrox rework that I've been waiting for since 2 years ago
I'll just link [this](https://boards.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-en/VpMEMpci-request-a-new-communicational-ping), a discussion recently made in the EU boards.
Oh that's handy thanks for this! I don't have an account that can message on the EU boards :( going to try to get one so I can acknowledge the idea! Thanks for linking it
wut, i'm from euw and can post on both na and eune (EUW god confirmed)

I am submitting a request to reconsider this ping.  Attached is a recreation of a portion of chat from both games I have played and watched others play.

After a lost team fight or enemy killing spree:
>(Morgana): guys we should group up now
>(Morgana): group
>(Warwick): Ocean Drake - Spawning in 1:29
>(Morgana): just group
>(Morgana): group
>(Morgana): group
>(Morgana): OMG GROUP
>(Viktor) purchased Control Ward
>(Morgana): group
>(Morgana): group
>(Morgana): gropu
>[All] (Morgana): group
>(Morgana): group

In short, I don't think that an easy to use ping that has no target nor any clear circumstances for usage is such a great idea.
I *think* you should be able to post on EU boars with your NA account, much like I'm able to post here from EUW...?

not sure how you would implement this but at the moment you have the option to target ping champions and that's usually what i do if i ping missing and they immediately return...
what if you could open another ping wheel when pinging enemy champions with options like;
"*champion* has returned"
"*champion* is Level 6"
"*champion* has 30% health"
etc.
(just brainstorming now )

Thanks for reading
{{champion:2}}

Probably gets to be a bit too into the nitty gritty. We want the ping system to be used for quick and easy to understand communication that has intent that can't be confused for either the pinger or the...pingee? If you tell me that Annie has 30% health what are you trying to tell me in the moment? That you should kill her? That she's still a threat so your teammate should be careful etc. When you tell me a champ is missing I know exactly what that means. When you say that there's enemy vision in a bush I know what that means, we need to maintain that level of clarity.

There's definitely some space in here for additives here, just need to be careful we don't bloat the system to much if/when we do!

I think right now I can't ping enemy health bar / mana bar. 

In conjuction with "assist me" / "caution" and "on the way" ping, I think it'll be fine to be able to ping the enemy hp / mana bar, while having their icon up.

At lower elos, I would like a "wait" ping for those jglers that don't know they need to wait for us to crash the wave before turret diving. 

Was watching Scarra's stream on day, and he wanted to tell his team "poke the enemy down", but his Sion Ulted in before he can finish the sentence.

An idea to go around the tech limitations of the wheel, is to follow what Smite does. Press V, brings up a box of things, (Press V again for these options, A for THESE options,) Its reaaaaallly cool cause it lets people do very specific callouts within a maximum of 3 clicks. You can implement this with the customizable ping wheel for if you need to access a certain ping real quick.
This is actually one of the things I had in mind. Having different wheels bound to different keys, the only thing that I'd want to figure out is what pings go on which wheel in this scenario.

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8UNe7507,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-02-27T02:42:53.560+0000)
>
> I'm actually really interested/invested in us creating more pings for players to use. When we made the "enemy vision here ping", we talked a bit about whether we could/should make more, but given the tech limitations (couldn't swap out pings on the ping wheel), I opted instead to just do the highest use case one (that the bush has a ward in it to warn your teammates). With the emotes wheel tech being complete, I'm **_hopeful_** that we'll actually be able to do stuff like this in the near future with some sort of configurable ping wheel (or maybe even a second one?). Your specific idea also came up in the dev corner post I made last december looking for dope ideas for 2018 (https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/aG96Psz9-featureqol-changeidea-generator-for-2018-and-beyond?sort_type=best&comment=0030), so it's obvious that the demand is there.
> 
> I'd love for us to be able to expand this beyond adding the "need vision here" ping, so here's an open question for all you folks reading this. Assume that you were in a game and had neither voice comms, or the ability to type. What are the most useful ping additions you think would be valuable for helping you coordinate with a team?
> 
> Ping Pitch:
> The "shit nvm" ping
> 
> Use case: I just pinged that my enemy laner was mia, but then they came back into the lane out of fog of war. I'd love to be able to ping "nvm" or *erase* the initial ping to let my team know that there's no imminent threat.

I think the best course of action once you can is just to increase the amount of pings on the ping wheel (like Overwatch). That way you avoid having to swap out pings or have different hotkeys for different pings and all that jazz.

The decision in the past was that subdividing the wheel beyond 4 quadrants made it harder to use the quick ping system for...well...pinging quickly. That's largely based on user experience/feedback at the time the decision was made, but it could certainly be that players (of all genres) have gotten better about precise decision making that like and we could now do it with less friction. If we could make the wheel be more configurable AND don't see players complaining about hitting the wrong ping all the time that'd certainly be a win, but we'd want to make sure that's the case first.

Is there a reason you opted to not use modifier keys, so you would still only have 4 quadrants, but pressing a different key would give you different options? 

I always found that the most logical scenario in fact I suggested this long before pings were even a thing back in season 1.

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8UNe7507,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-02-27T05:29:16.952+0000)
>
> The decision in the past was that subdividing the wheel beyond 4 quadrants made it harder to use the quick ping system for...well...pinging quickly. That's largely based on user experience/feedback at the time the decision was made, but it could certainly be that players (of all genres) have gotten better about precise decision making that like and we could now do it with less friction. If we could make the wheel be more configurable AND don't see players complaining about hitting the wrong ping all the time that'd certainly be a win, but we'd want to make sure that's the case first.

While the 4 quadrants are nice for manual mouse use; I have gaming peripheral with like 40 buttons and an extra joystick for my thumb that easily accommodates more ping options when hotkeyed correctly. And frankly, thats the sorta thing one buys these things for.

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8UNe7507,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-02-27T02:42:53.560+0000)
>
> Ping Pitch:
> The "shit nvm" ping
> 
> Use case: I just pinged that my enemy laner was mia, but then they came back into the lane out of fog of war. I'd love to be able to ping "nvm" or *erase* the initial ping to let my team know that there's no imminent threat.

Something that i always wanted but only discovered now. wow

I think "enemy here" ping could be used to communicate variety of messages.

Is your laner missing? Ping the river. Did you see the enemy jungler heading to topside? Ping topside enemy jungle. Is the enemy invading? Ping your jungle. Did you missing ping but the enemy came back? Ping your lane again. Is the enemy splitpushing and nobody is responding? Ping the lane that's being pushed.
It would be ideal to combine this with other pings (like pinging "Ahri:Alive" before pinging the river), but this can be very useful.

I would be 100% on board for having pings that have no default hotkey, and are only available if you add them in a menu.

could even do it like the emote wheel--you know which pings you use most in game, so you can create a wheel for them. (or, you know, just change hotkeys when u die, like i do)

Need vision, Bait, Engage.

New ping wheel would have Warded, Bait, Engage, Need Vision. (top/right/bottom/left)

Make it so the current ping wheel is accessible from alt/g and the new ping wheel is accessible from ctrl/v.

Pressing the other key makes you enter negation mode. So Alt+Ctrl+dragging or Alt+dragging+Ctrl would give you these options:
Safe, Not Going, Don't Need Help, Enemy is Back.

And Ctrl+Alt+dragging or Ctrl+dragging+Alt would give:
Not warded, They Know, Don't Engage, Don't Ward Yet.

Finally, the ability to ping enemy ults from the scoreboard would be nice.

Aside from the cancel ping, not much.  You can already ping most UI elements to report them in chat, and that covers about 90% of the info most people need.  A vision request ping as the OP suggests would also be kind of nice, but that is liable to go off into the weeds fast given the insanely restricted amount of vision in the game right now.

I would however love to see:

1. HP and resource bar pings actually show both the percentage _and_ the exact value.  There's a pretty big difference between a Sivir with no mana items having 5% mana, and a Ryze with fully stacked RoA and Seraph's having 5% mana.

2. Easier way to quickly ping enemy summoner spells and ult down.  Maybe have a ping-wheel pop up when you try to ping an enemy and hold the button, with the default being targeting or avoiding depending on alert or retreat ping, and then have options to ping summoners and ult as 3 of the 4, with the other one being the opposite of the default.

3. The ability to more readily customize ping sounds.  Right now, it's pretty much impossible to distinguish most pings by sound alone, and therefore I _always_ have to check chat and usually the minimap pretty much immediately when someone pings something.  It would be nice to know more quickly what it is if it's not visible on-screen.

4. A possible alternative to the ping wheel that doesn't need the mouse.  I've commented a couple of times before that I really prefer SMITE's hot-key based menu for selecting pings.  Using a sequence of about 3-4 keystrokes, you can convey enough info that you can even do some rudimentary high-level strategization with your team (as in asking someone to split push while the rest of the team forces another lane) without needing to use chat at all.  I'm not saying League needs things _that_ expressive (most people in SMITE use about 2 dozen of the ping options, but they have separate pings for each lane because they do vocal callouts for the pings instead of just a simple noise), but at least having the option to ping like that for things that require you targeting part of the UI instead of the map would be nice.
Add the "ima afk pizza is burning brb" ping please
"I thought I put my food in the microwave for 40 seconds, turns out it was 40 minutes and shits on fire yo, brb"

I, for one, would highly appreciate this ping. As a support, I'm constantly warding, and if I run out, I'd love to be able to let the adc know where there should be one and get that info to them as quickly and as efficiently as I can.

+1 to the idea

I would love to be able to ping this on people's corpses when they die wandering into an area with no vision.

Yes please.
i also think the fact we can see vision score is stupid... i dont care what my adc vision score is i want to know if his ward is on cooldown.
please no is there not enough ping spam in this game
not sure how adding a new ping changes or modifies the fact anyone can spam ANY ping 6 times.
Not sure if anyone has mentioned this yet, but I frequently wish there was a **"Enemy does NOT have vision here"** ping, so I can inform my jungler about safe paths for ganking.

It would be really neat to have a "Jungler Spotted" ping of some sort.

Ping his blue with it, Jungle started blue. See him bot side, top, etc. The ability to ping out where their jungler currently is on the map.

as a support main who runs out of wards
I approve.
I used to just ping that I didn't have wards then normal ping a bush, wish we could have number of pings back
